title: Hibernate runtime property persisting after build
body:
### Describe the bug

The hibernate runtime property `quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation=drop-and-create`  persisting when set using environment variable during build  process as `set QUARKUS_HIBERNATE_ORM_DATABASE_GENERATION=drop-and-create `. 

After build this is used by application at runtime even if it is not set/configured in `application.properties`  file.  The default value of this config property is `none`.






### Expected behavior

`quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation=drop-and-create` should not persist after building even if we have set the environment variable `set QUARKUS_HIBERNATE_ORM_DATABASE_GENERATION=drop-and-create ` during build process.

We are not specifying this property quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation=drop-and-create` in our application.properties file hence it should take none as default value while running application as  java -jar quarkus-run.jar .

### Actual behavior

The hibernate runtime property `quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation=drop-and-create`  persisting when set using environment variable during build  process as `set QUARKUS_HIBERNATE_ORM_DATABASE_GENERATION=drop-and-create `. 

After build this is used by application at runtime even if it is not set/configured in `application.properties`  file.  The default value of this config property is `none`.



### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer steps : 

1. Set environment variable `set QUARKUS_HIBERNATE_ORM_DATABASE_GENERATION=drop-and-create `.
2. Build the application using `mvn clean install`.
3. Do not specify `quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation=drop-and-create` in application.properties file.
4. Run the application jar in other session/terminal  `java -jar quarkus-run.jar ` .
5. Application executes drop and create for tables instead of doing nothing.


Attached reproducer
[code-with-quarkus.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/14585171/code-with-quarkus.zip)
